programme.title: Next Big Trip
programme.desc: Angola is now emerging as Africa's untouched gem. It's one of the last places to get away, get off the grid, and get back to why we leave home in the first place. Join Will Ripley as he travels from the mountains to the desert to the sea on a bucket list vacation of facing down fears, finding quiet places, and exploring the unexpected.

programme.title: Inside Africa
programme.desc: Across music, dance and comedy, a new wave of Ugandan performers is captivating audiences, all while championing a vibrant creative culture at home. We spotlight three standout talents : Afro-soul musician Joshua Baraka, international Latin dance maestro Valentino R. Kabenge, and comedy superstar Kansiime Anne, exploring how venues like the Uganda National Cultural Centre are nurturing the next generation of Ugandan performers.

programme.title: African Voices Changemakers
programme.desc: Larry Madowo travels to Nsukka, Nigeria, to spotlight acclaimed author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie. From global bestsellers like 'Purple Hibiscus' and 'Americanah' to her new novel 'Dream Count,' Adichie discusses her creative journey, cultural influences, and how she's redefining African storytelling on the world stage.

programme.title: Intelligent Future
programme.desc: Emerging technologies are transforming life as we know it. Meet the intelligent minds that are shaping our future. Many of these ideas are already transforming Abu Dhabi into a city of the future. In conversation with Analog's Alex Kipman and teamLab's Takashi Kudo, we explore how the emirate is integrating AI with sports and art for new lived experiences.

programme.title: Marketplace Africa
programme.desc: As tourist numbers continue to rise worldwide, African wildlife parks are facing unprecedented challenges. In Kenya's iconic Masai Mara Reserve, the home of the Great Migration and one of the natural wonders of the world, the number of wildebeest migrating has dropped as tourist numbers have gone up. We take a look at the delicate balancing act required to ensure the preservation of the migration with evergrowing travel demands.

programme.title: Marketplace Europe
programme.desc: We're in northern Italy for the annual Ambrosetti Forum, where political and economic leaders from across Europe come together every year. In a dynamically changing and unstable global landscape, the forum promises to spark engaging conversations about the state of Europe's economy.

programme.title: Call to Earth
programme.desc: World-renowned wildlife photographer Chris Fallows leads an inspiring journey from South Africa to Tanzania, highlighting the threats facing some of Africa's most wild places and celebrating those racing to save them.

programme.title: Inside Africa
programme.desc: Across music, dance and comedy, a new wave of Ugandan performers is captivating audiences, all while championing a vibrant creative culture at home. We spotlight three standout talents : Afro-soul musician Joshua Baraka, international Latin dance maestro Valentino R. Kabenge, and comedy superstar Kansiime Anne, exploring how venues like the Uganda National Cultural Centre are nurturing the next generation of Ugandan performers.

programme.title: Blueprint
programme.desc: Many people travel to Mongolia to disconnect, to escape into the vast wilderness and switch off. But for Mongolians, connectivity is everything. programme.desc: The Nicobar Islands were significantly impacted by the massive tsunami of 2004. This documentary is a compelling exploration of nature's ability to adapt to millions of years of gradual tectonic change and a sudden natural disaster, and a journey into a world few people are fortunate enough to see.

programme.title: Killer Safari
programme.desc: A cheetah disappears underwater in seconds; a crocodile faces down ten lions; a buffalo plays tug-of-war with a crocodile‚Äôs nose ‚Äì and loses. There‚Äôs no doubt that crocodiles rule Africa‚Äôs waterways where invisibility and stealth are their secret weapons. This safari gives you a front row seat to witness the explosive action of every surprise encounter.

programme.title: Jaguar Beach
programme.desc: On a remote stretch of Central America‚Äôs Pacific coast, the lush, volcanic landscape gives way to a startlingly different world: a dry tropical forest. Here, two creatures ‚Äî the sea turtle and the jaguar ‚Äî meet with spectacular consequences for both their species and the very different environments they inhabit, and an unwitting alliance turns the predator into the protector.

programme.title: Nicobar Islands: A Monkey's Long Tale
programme.desc: The Nicobar Islands were significantly impacted by the massive tsunami of 2004. This documentary is a compelling exploration of nature's ability to adapt to millions of years of gradual tectonic change and a sudden natural disaster, and a journey into a world few people are fortunate enough to see.

programme.title: Untamed Philippines
programme.desc: Moving from turtles of the Palawan coast to the unique National Marine Park at Tubbataha, to meet giants, whale sharks and manta rays. We also see how people can mediate between people and wildlife as we join a snake hunting team catching and translocating a deadly Samar cobra.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Summer heat requires Dr. Pol to pivot his approach while treating a sick cow. A Great Dane and a thirty-year-old horse fall victim to icy ground. Dr. Brenda aids in a complicated springtime calving. From frigid temperatures to a sweltering sun, from muddy pens to dusty pastures, the conditions that Mother Nature creates in central Michigan for both animals and vets is a force to be reckoned with.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: From a muskrat attack to a cat missing an eye, the clinic is full of surprises. Dr. Pol rushes to an Amish farm to help a cow thats been in labor for 24 hours, and Dr. Nicole treats her dogs injured leg. Dr. Brenda gives step-by-step care instructions to a family new to raising Scottish Highland cows, and Dr. Lisa does a dental exam on Elvis the donkey. Dr. Nicole shares exciting news! .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Jeepers! That‚Äôs something you don‚Äôt see every day. In this special episode, Dr. Pol‚Äôs expertise and intuition will be put to the test by the strangest and most amazing cases. A cat thinks the world is spinning, a Jack Russell has painful eyes, and a baby pony is fainting. Time to put the book smarts to the test! .

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals survive by using camouflage, mimicry, and stealth tactics. From tigers who hunt in plain sight using their orange fur as camouflage, and a spider who mimics an ant to sneak into a colony, to a bird that uses false alarm calls to trick meerkats into giving up their prey, nature deploys remarkable deception to survive.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: The battle between predator and prey is not always about power and strength. Knowing what lurks in the dark can mean the difference between life and death. Extraordinary powers that penetrate darkness give some creatures the edge, and the chance to live another day.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: To win the game of life, it can take more than brute force. Animals with a super-powered sixth sense can get the edge on fast-moving prey, beat the elements, and find food in unlikely places.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: Monkey Wars
programme.desc: The Simien Mountains in Ethiopia are home to geladas, the only monkey in the world that grazes. They form large and powerful family groups with complex social hierarchies and fickle relationships. Young bachelor males yearn for power, and when the time is right, they take their chance to grab it with great violence. The alpha male faces a world of pressure on his shoulders.

programme.title: Primate Planet
programme.desc: From tropical treetops to snowy peaks, Primate Planet takes you on a whirlwind tour of the wild world of primates, uncovering their unique behaviors, strong family bonds, and surprising personalities.

programme.title: China's Wild Empire
programme.desc: The high mountain forests of China‚Äôs Shennongjia National Park are home to golden snub-nosed monkeys. Told across a year, this film features two family clans battling it out for food, mates and social status. To survive and prosper they must endure extreme weather, food shortages, predator pressures and battles with rivals, in a society where it‚Äôs ultimately the females who hold big sway.
